title: Sylvain Bied
text:
Sylvain Bied (26 February 1965 – 18 February 2011) was a French professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and manager. He played as a <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>.
Playing career.
Bied was a product of the <a href="Paris%20Saint-Germain%20F.C.">Paris Saint-Germain</a> <a href="Paris%20Saint-Germain%20Youth%20Academy">youth academy</a>. He was the third choice <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a> of the first team during the <a href="1984%E2%80%9385%20Paris%20Saint-Germain%20F.C.%20season">1984–85</a> season, while integrating the squad at the age of 19. On 26 March 1985, Bied played his first and only match for PSG, a 4–2 league loss to <a href="RC%20Lens">Lens</a>. He conceded the opening goal of the match in the first 84 seconds of play.
Bied left PSG in the summer of 1985 to join <a href="Valenciennes%20FC">Valenciennes</a>. He went on to play for <a href="Amiens%20SC">Amiens</a>, , <a href="US%20Orl%C3%A9ans">Orléans</a>, <a href="Dijon%20FCO">Dijon</a>, <a href="Angers%20SCO">Angers</a>, and <a href="Saint-Pryv%C3%A9%20Saint-Hilaire%20FC">Saint-Pryvé Saint-Hilaire</a> before retiring in 1999.
Managerial career.
Bied was <a href="Player-coach">player-manager</a> for <a href="Saint-Pryv%C3%A9%20Saint-Hilaire%20FC">Saint-Pryvé Saint-Hilaire</a> in the last two years of his playing career. He then spent nine years as the goalkeeping coach for <a href="Amiens%20SC">Amiens</a>, <a href="Stade%20Lavallois">Laval</a>, FC Ailly-sur-Somme Samara, and <a href="AS%20Beauvais%20Oise">Beauvais</a>. In 2008, Bied became the manager of CSA Montières Étouvie.
